about_the_game:
Overview

The Victor Initiative is a first-person survival horror game in which you explore the halls of an abandoned government facility in order to discover its secrets while evading the strange entities lurking within. The game is divided into separate floors, which all present unique challenges. These floors make up larger 'chapters', which present widely different threats for you to outsmart. The demo includes the first chapter of the game.

Gameplay

In The Victor Initiative, you have no health bar, nothing telling you what to do and one main goal: surviving. From a first person perspective, make your way through the winding halls of The Initiative in a bid to survive to the next room. Each room will present a new threat, or a new puzzle that you need to solve in order to keep pushing through. With no tools, no knowledge, and just your environment & the occasional patchy audio log for clues, will you be able to survive?

The Mission

It's your job to explore an abandoned government facility that lost contact with the rest of the world 60 years ago. What horrors will you discover within?

The Initiative

The Initiative was a mysterious government outpost that rarely communicated with the outside world, but 60 years ago, communicated stopped completely. Now, the freelance organisation you work for has been contracted to investigate what actually happened there.

Something's wrong... Very wrong.

Inside The Initiative is a spiralling maze of horrors. Deranged ramblings adorn the walls, loose papers are strewn across the floor and there seems to be something inside the security monitors.

This place is not what it seems.

As you explore the halls of the facility, you'll begin to notice that things aren't quite.. normal. Technology way ahead of its time, geometry that shouldn't be possible... It's up to you to solve the mystery.

You are not alone.

The worst thing about this place, however, is that it feels like SOMETHING'S WATCHING YOU. You'll need to use clues hidden in the environment and your own wits to make sure that you don't meet an... untimely demise.
